event.description:
Seeking an urban refuge for the teaching and practice of insight meditation?  Drawing on the rich teachings of Buddhist masters and his life experiences in the east and west, Kushok will provide commentary and lead students in meditations designed to help you gain experience in how to develop an analytical approach to meditation.

Join us for this 7-week course to learn how to use the power of a focused mind to analyze habitual ingrained patterns of thought, philosophical points, and other aspects of the path. Analytical meditation is critical for enhancing the benefits of calm abiding meditation and vice versa. The two forms of meditation are complementary. Calm Abiding cultivates the ability to focus single-pointedly and Analytical meditation uses this clarity of mind to examine various states of mind and points of philosophy. Once the mind has gained certainty on the points being examined then the meditator switches back to Calm Abiding and rests the mind in that certainty. Through this alternation of the two practices one's meditation continually deepens.

The course runs 7:00-8:30 pm every Tuesday from Nov 1 to Dec 13 at Gaden Samten Ling’s Alberta Centre for Peace & Meditation located at 11403-101 Street in Edmonton. We invite you to stay afterward for tea, visiting with classmates, a browse of the bookstore, or a visit to our member’s library.

Course fee $80. Registration & payment deadline October 25, 2016. To register online, please visit www.gasamling.ca. To register by phone call 780-479-0014.
event.title: Insight Meditation

event.description:
The Choir of King’s College, Cambridge is undoubtedly one of the world’s best known choral groups; every Christmas Eve, millions of people worldwide tune into A Festival of Nine Lessons and Carols, a service that has been broadcast by the BBC since 1928. While the Choir exists primarily to sing the daily services in King’s College Chapel, its international fame and reputation, enhanced by an extensive recording catalogue, since 2012 on their own label, has led to invitations to perform around the world.

“Moments of iridescence… creating vividness in restraint through the unadorned splendour of this superbly polished vocal sound.” – Sydney Morning Herald

“I would happily sit in King’s College Chapel listening to this choir sing for the rest of my days.” – The London Times

Supported by the Alvin S. Nemetz Foundation, and Birgit Westergaard & Norman Gladstone

Pre-concert talk at 1:15pm.

event.description: An Exhibition by Penny Parry Within the next few generations, how many physical experiences will be traded in for virtual ones?  More to the point, what might we as humans lose – how might we change in our basic nature, in such a headlong rush to embrace the virtual?  This mixed media installation will challenge this thought by offering aspects of the ‘physical book experience’ that sharpen and feed our senses. Penny Parry likes to play with ideas.  Her work is based in photography and narrative.  For many years, she has struggled with how to present her work and in doing so, has become more and more interested in the form and function of the book as a physical object.  In undertaking this exploration, the question of the impact of losing this particular experience evolved. Using Alice in Wonderland as inspiration, Parry uses photography, found objects and the creation of a 5 ft story book to invite the viewer to explore the value and joy of the physical book. Come turn some very large pages! Opening: October 14th, 7pm-9pmCraft Council Gallery1386 Cartwright Street, Granville Island Artist Talk: (space is limited please RSVP to attend)October 14th, 6pm-7pm Tyee Room, False Creek Community Center, Granville Island(two buildings east of the Craft Council Gallery) Exhibiton Supported by:
event.title: to have & to hold – the physical book: more than a quaint tradition

event.description: Starting Lean: Value Proposition (2 sessions, 4 hours each) *Doors open at 12:00 pm. Workshop starts at 12:30 pm. Entrepreneur's Toolkit Workshops are experiential, hands-on workshops facilitated by experienced entrepreneurs. The workshops offer ventures tools, mentoring and peer feedback to solve specific problems and develop essential business components. In each four-hour session you will generate a deliverable that you will use frequently in the business development process. Do you have an idea or a product that you would like to turn into a business? This two-part workshop series is designed to help early-stage ventures understand the Lean Startup approach and learn ways to start collecting feedback from potential customers. The tools and frameworks covered in the workshop will help you to lower the risk associated with launching your new product or business. Our approach will also help new ventures to better understand how sales and marketing activities can be organized to land the first customers. Workshop Schedule Session 1 – Preparing to leave the building October 14, 2016 // 12:30-4:30 pm Establish a process to clarify and test key assumptions you have about your business and lower your ventures overall risk. Deliverable:  Overview of the Lean Startup approach and a tested interview guide based on the venture’s most important foundational assumptions.  Session 2 – Determining your value proposition  October 21, 2016 // 12:30-4:30 pm Use data obtained from customer interviews to synthesize customer feedback into a value proposition. Deliverable: A framework and template for determining your value proposition    Cost of workshops The Entrepreneur's Toolkit Workshops cost $100 to attend. There are two different ticket types that can be purchased: 1.     ONE Client Refundable Deposit Purchase this ticket if you are a client of: Innovate Niagara St. Catharines Small Business Enterprise Centre Niagara Falls Small Business Enterprise Centre Purchase this ticket if you are a client of a regional innovation centre (Ontario Network of Entrepreneurs). When prompted on the registration page, please list the organization of which you are a member and your current advisor’s name. You will be refunded your full ticket price at the end of the workshop series  and upon completion of our post-workshop survey. 2.     General Attendance Fee Purchase this ticket if you are not currently a member of an organization with the Ontario Network of Entrepreneurs.    **If you are unable to attend a workshop session, please let us know four business days in advance. We regret that failure to do so may result in the loss of your deposit. **The post-workshop survey must be completed within seven days of the last day of a workshop series for a registration deposit or discount to be refunded. If you would like more information on our workshop programs or how to become a client of a regional innovation centre, please contact workshops@marsdd.com.   Find out about new workshops by joining our mailing list.
event.title: Innovate Niagara: Starting Lean: Value Proposition- October 14 & 21, 2016

event.description: Puppies form and solidify their impression of the world in their first 20 weeks of life. We call this the ‘critical socialization window’. What they experience in this period determines how adaptable, calm and confident they’ll be as adults. This class is broken up into two different age groups to accommodate different developmental levels: Tots and Tweeners. We’ll help you to socialize your puppy to new people, dogs, sights and sounds in a safe and positive environment. Learn how to encourage appropriate behaviour and set boundaries. Get a solid start on the most important skills a dog needs, such as bite inhibition, recall, down, house training, appropriate dog-dog skills and more. Build a strong relationship with your puppy based on mutual trust and respect! Requirements: Tots for puppies to start between 10 – 15 weeks of age who have had their second set of vaccinations. Tweeners for puppies to start between 16-20 weeks of age who have had their second set of vaccinations. Classes are 45 minutes long and run continuously. Start the first week your dog is vaccinated and keep coming back for 5 consecutive weeks. $209 for non-members, $190 for CHS members, seniors and dogs rescued from shelters or other rescue organizations (including CHS, Animal Services, ARF, etc.) Fees are non-refundable.
event.title: Precocious Puppies (Tweeners 16-20 Weeks Old) Tuesday October 11, 2016 @ 7pm

event.description: DO YOU WANT TO WRITE A BOOK?  (blog, memoir, play, a series of short stories, stand-up comedy, fiction, creative non-fiction etc) Limited to 10 People (Advance Registration Recommended) Has anyone ever said to you… “I think you should write a book.” And you said, “Me? I don’t think so.”… Yet it sparks something in you that resonates deeply but you brush it aside. Or perhaps it has been a secret desire you have had for years but you don’t know how or where to begin. Maybe you are already in the midst of writing a book, blog, play or short story, but can’t seem to stay focused, so you stop.  Putting your voice out into the world in the form of a published work is a big deal. It’s a reflection of you—your imagination, thoughts, opinions, and often your tender heart!  If you are not used to being “out there” it can actually be terrifying.  Junie is an  author, playwright, and writing coach and for over 20 years she has also been working as a  psychotherapist. So along with her expertise in coaching writers to find their voice, become better writers and author books, she holds a sacred space for whatever emotional issues may arise throughout the writing and sharing process. What You Can Expect Weekly for 10 weeks, you will gather together with other writers to read and discuss what you have been working on for the past week—a chapter, an introduction, or something you are re-working. Even if you haven’t written anything that week, you will not be overlooked. I will work with you and discuss what may be holding you back and formulate strategies to move forward. A Holistic Experience: Students experience this program as above and beyond author support. Instead it is a sacred circle. It is an environment that at the same time you are being mentored in the craft of writing,  your heart is also held in the highest esteem.  Feedback: Everyone receives feedback from other group members and Junie. The feedback is always given with kindness and respect. It is specific, offering clarity about what’s working, what is not; what could use re-writing or tweaking—regarding characters, continuity, redundancy, length, believability etc. Are you speaking in the right voice for your audience, for your characters if it is fiction? Are you skimming the surface, needing to go deeper in order to get the reader fully involved—to make it compelling?  Do you use any of these reasons (excuses) to stop yourself from writing? It’s already been written There are already enough books on the subject I don’t want to hurt anyone Who am I to say this? I’m not an authority I’m afraid of peoples’ judgments I don’t know how to write I can’t spell I’m too old to start now; it’s too late It will take too long It’s too difficult You’re Not Alone! These common concerns will be dispelled right off the bat! Why be mentored by Junie Swadron? Junie has successfully coached thousands of writers, many of whom have become authors. In the process, they have also found their authentic voices which, in many cases, had been silenced for years. Things came full circle for her when  she wrote and published Re-Write Your Life and received a beautiful endorsement from her creative mentor, Julia Cameron, Author of The Artist’s Way “Junie Swadron is both a guide and a muse. Her book is a bright lantern, illuminating the often dark and tricky terrain of the soul. Grounded in personal experience, her techniques catalyze the deep authenticity possible to us all.” Here are 2 scenarios. Which one will YOU choose? 1st SCENARIO You want to write a book You don’t know how or where to begin You don’t think you are good enough There are things you know about and care about You are hesitant to say them out loud You are afraid of what people might think or say There are other reasons too You begin to shrink You stop Your dream ENDS here. 2nd SCENARIO You want to write a book You don’t know how or where to begin There are things you know and care about You are hesitant to say them out loud You are afraid of what people might think or say There are other reasons too Still, you say to yourself, “I am willing to feel the discomfort, put my fears aside and GO FOR IT.” Your dream BEGINS here. AND YOU WON'T HAVE TO DO IT ALONE! It will be my joy and privilege to guide you right to the finish line. Love, Junie  “Your soul meets you on the page and something shifts. You strengthen. You begin to stand taller. And soon you begin to notice that your voice on the page has become your voice in the world.” Junie Swadron TESTIMONIALS  “Junie, it seems so simple and natural when you do it, but I don’t know anyone who hears and says back so clearly when I read my writing or speak my truth. You are the mirror who shines a light in the darkness just when I’ve convinced myself to give up, again. Thank you.”~Susan Beach “I had the opportunity to attend Junie Swadron’s Author Mentorship Program earlier this year. My manuscript, Julia’s Secret, had been stuck in a drawer for a couple of years at that time. I received amazing support and guidance from Junie and from the group. Junie is a wonderful facilitator—honest and heartfelt. The sessions were full of fun and extremely encouraging. Julia’s Secret is now finished and just waiting for the illustrations! My blog is out there too. The Author Mentorship Program was a brilliant kick starter. I recommend it 100%—with all my heart”    ~Anne Sture “When I began the group I was feeling stuck and uninspired. The weekly meetings provided the impetus to work on new material which created momentum (and progress). The support and feedback of the group was invaluable, making reflections available for writing still fresh on the page, applauding the successes and lovingly calling for more if the best was yet unwritten.”  ~Rob Mason “I participated in a writer’s support group with Junie and as I reflect back it still strikes me how much of a healing process it was. I thought I was joining a writing group which would give me some more writing tools to add to my belt, but I was pleasantly surprised, and I got much much more than that! This 8-week course was a catalyst for my leap of health that I find myself now. I can now stand lounging in this stronger place, enjoying the serenity that comes after releasing more of the layers of pain, after finding my way to healthier routines and habits. Junie’s programme helped me to see that indeed I have writing skills and gifts and it motivated me to pick up the pen and move on some projects that have been lying dormant for years. I am so grateful that Junie is honouring her gifts and sharing this with the world. The people that she attracts to the group are just as powerful, compassionate and inspiring as she is! Like attracts like. I feel honoured that I was in the same circle with such talented and creative people. Thanks Junie!     ~Kelly Terbasket “The Author Mentorship Program provided me with the encouragement and support to find my voice on paper and believe in it! Junie is a compassionate, skilled, intuitive and gentle facilitator… Amazing! Thank you!”    ~Pauline Karch “My Victoria Bench by Bench writings started before the book was even considered. Junie Swadron’s workshops nudged me back into a habit of writing. June’s special talent for facilitating writing groups pulled the words out of me. I started writing, not only for myself, but to share with others.”   ~Rebecca Kennel “The Author Mentorship Program has been a very nurturing environment to hatch my fledgling play and gradually take the steps to learn to fly. A great environment to meet others of like mind.“   ~Amy Robertson  “I loved being in the safe container of the Author Mentorship Program. The words of encouragement and wisdom from June and my sister writers were like powerful medicine, inspiring me to write and then write some more. I look forward to continuing and meeting more writers in the September group.”  ~Monica Kingsbury  “I am extremely privileged to have the opportunity of working with Junie as my writing coach as a prelude to the launch of a book or books in progress. I have personally experienced her magnificent facilitation and Junie’s gentle, yet powerful leadership skills propel all into a sacred space of acknowledgement, acceptance, safety and unleashed creativity. Junie’s processes guided by integrity, authenticity and absolute kindness create an atmosphere for raucous fun as well as ‘sacred reverence’. One of the most important gifts that I’ve received from Junie is learning to honour the sacred process of connecting with and expressing my own unique voice.”   ~Jeraldine Estin “As a writer working on my first book, I found June’s suggestions invaluable. Writing can be lonely work; her approach encouraged a strong bonding and mutual support among the group members. Especially helpful were tips on how to still the negative inner critic and how to break through writer’s block. I highly recommend The Author Mentorship Program.”  ~Ella Brown “Your love, friendship, advice and support encouraged me to finally birth this work of fiction, so long in gestation.”  ~Julia Joldersma LIMITED TO 10 PARTICIPANTS Advance Registration Recommended! Junie Swadron Psychotherapist, Author & Writing Mentor   www.junieswadron.com  250-813-0183 junie@junieswadron.com Please see website for payment plan: http://junieswadron.com/workshops/author-support/

event.description: Saturdays 10 weeks/30hrs Portfolio Courses are intended for students who are applying for admission to programs where they are required to submit a portfolio of their art work. This includes both high school visual arts programs as well as post-secondary programs  such as Fine Arts, Architecture, Illustration and Design, including Graphic Design and Advertising, Interior, Fashion and Industrial Design, Environmental Design, Design for Theatre, Video and Installation, Illustration, Animation, and/or any other fine and applied art, or visual art related programs.  In addition to the basics, such as drawing, painting, colour, and composition, the curriculum is content flexible, always considering the up -to -date requirements of the programs chosen by each one of our students. Students will be introduced to basic art and design theory, but the main emphasis is on  the practical studio skills and hands-on projects. Special attention will be given to training students how to properly generate and develop original ideas and concepts, with the objective to prepare and execute projects based on those ideas, while respecting the imposed guidelines and deadlines. Group critiquing and discussions of contemporary issues and trends in the visual art practices is an important  part of the course, helping prepare students for a potential interview, presentation, and/or a hands-on admission test.
event.title: FKT16PBAD Portfolio for Art/Architecture/Design (14-17) with M.B.J./K.Eic

event.description: Tuesdays 9:30am-12:30pm for 11weeks/33 hrs This course is materials /techniques based. Roll up your slieves and get your hands dirty while splashing and slashing, pulling and pushing. Unleash your creativity under the gentle guidance of a professional artist/art instructor. Explore and create in a fun, loosley structured, and alvays supportive studio environment.
event.title: FA16MM Mixed Media (B/I/A) with TBD

event.description: Mondays 6:30pm-9:30pm 9 weeks/27hrs This class will teach and demonstrate hands-on the traditional oil painting techniques used by the old masters in order to create luminous paintings of still life, portrait, figure, or landscape. From preparing and priming of canvas, palette organizing and mixing of skin tone, to proper use of mediums, through underpainting, layering, glazing and scumbling techniques, you will learn the painting process step-by-step from start to finish. The objective is to produce one classical style portrait from a good tonal contrast photo, one small still life from life, and a small size landscape with a figure in it, also from a photograph. Intermediate drawing skills are an asset, but not required. It is recommended that you carry and use a small sketch book at all times. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16OMT Oil Media and Techniques (B/I) with Mahmoud Meraji

event.description: Wednesdays 1:00-4:00pm for 10 weeks/30hrs This course will focus on the medium of Acrylic and it's painting potential. Students will be introduced to various acrylic materials, such as gels, emulsions, pastes, retarders, extenders and so on. Techniques will be demonstrated and applied while painting on different grounds. Brushes and palette knives will be discussed and their uses demonstrated. By the end of this course students should be quite comfortable executing a more complex acrylic compositions, not affraid to experiment with the Acrylic painting medium.
event.title: FA16APT Acrylic Painting Techniques(B/I/A) with TBD

event.description: Tuesdays 6:30-9:30pm for 9 weeks/27hrs If you look at the urban scape and sense it's soul, or see a kind of beauty that triggers an emotional response, this class is for you. Urban landscape or urban scape, can be many things, as one can find many different things within a city. Students will work from photographs, preferably their own, of urban scenes. The process will include constructing the composition, deciding on a focal point, and choosing scale, size and technique. Instructor will help you by guiding you through the process, and navigate you to explore your own mind, and to search for meaning of chosen image through the painting process. Techniques may be demonstrated, and examples of relevant work shown. Materials list will be given.
event.title: FA16ULP Urban Landscape Painting (B/I/A) with TBD

event.description: Thursdays 9:30am-12:30pm for 10 weeks/30hrs This course is for all who wish to improve their watercolour skills and technique. Each student is approached on their own level and instruction adapted to help every student further develop technically as well as conceptually. As the skills strengthen so does students' confidence. Demonstrations are available, and experiments encouraged, while the students dictate the pace. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16WP Watercolour Painting (B/I/A) with Marija Barac Jandric

event.description: Thursdays,  6 weeks/12 hrs Learn what a curator and what an art conservator do. They both take care of artworks but in a vastly different approach. The work of a curator is mostly visual, to display in a given space works of art to their fullest advantage. The art conservator is concern about proper handling, display, storage etc. in order to prolong the longevity of  artworks. Students will learn how to mount an exhibition, how to frame, hung and/or make small repairs when professional assistance is not available.
event.title: FA16W-CAC Be a Curator/Art Conservator with Srebrenka Bogovic Zeskoski

event.description: Fridays 1:00-4:00pm 9 weeks/27hrs It's not easy to paint kids portrait well. People mostly just copy from photographs with varying results. In this course we will also work from photos, but we will learn how to "read" the photo, and how to build a natural and believable image of a child capturing the energy and livelyness instead of stiffness.
event.title: FA16PPK Painting Portraits of Kids (B/I) with Jane Mikas

event.description: Wednesdays, 10 weeks/20hrs Afterschool and Youth Program is designed to help spark creativity and let kids express their own ideas and develop imagination through fun and engaging age-appropriate projects and exercises.  Programs that involve Drawing, Painting, Colour, and Illustration, will introduced specific fundamentals and techniques such as the use of line, tone, colour, and texture in achieving a sense of shape, form, depth and movement. Kids will be introduced to basics of concept, composition, perspective, focal point, contrast, and some other elements of visual communication. They will also learn how to mix colour and how to avoid creating a muddy mess on the palette.  Through fun and interesting exercises students will be challenged at their own level, to sharpen their observation and challenge their perception of the visual world.  The program fosters a nurturing yet structured approach and atmosphere, with plenty of personal attention and gentle encouragement.  Non toxic student quality water based media such as acrylic or tempera will be used in the hands-on studio-based approach.
event.title: FKT16FIP Fundamentals of Illustration/Painting (Grades 6 – 8) with Mike Goodge

event.description: Saturdays 1:00-4:00pm 11 weeks/33hrs  There is a long tradition of miniature scale painting throughout art history. This course will adress the historical perspective and some important examples from different periods will be discussed in the class. The scale of the painting plays a major role in miniature art, so it is important to pick the right subject matter and execution in order to create interest. Composition and concept development, along with colour use and application will be discussed with each student separately. "Less is more" is a guiding principal in this discipline.
event.title: FA16MSP Miniature Scale Painting (B/I/A) with TBD

event.description: Monday 9:30am-12:30pm, for 6 weeks /18 hrs  The Mighty 8 x 10 Plein Aire Landscape Painting Plein Air painting is an exciting method of painting outdoors directly from your subject to express the fleeting effects of light, structure, colour. The small, but mighty 8 by 10 sketch has a tremendous ability to hold vitality because of it's small size which naturally highlights confident and bold painterly approaches. It is suitable for small trips and for on hikes and relaxing visits to the park. This class will introduce the 8 by 10 format and some modern working methods of the Impressionists and Group of Seven that will help you express your own experiences in nature. The outdoor sessions in this class will take place in the beautiful Rosetta Gardens. Individual support for personal aesthetics and for thematic concerns will be addressed in class and on-site while painting. The mightly 8x10 format will unleash your confidence propel your practice to journey into landscape painting. Let's get started!
event.title: FA16PAR Plein Air at Rosetta McLain Gardens (B/I/A) with Byron Hodgins

event.description: Thursdays 4:00-5:30pm, 10 weeks/15hrs This course is a great opportunity for a young student to experience the versatile clay medium, while exploring the possibilities and challenges of making 3D art.  It is an especially good idea for those who are mostly used to expressing themselves in 2D, to start further developing  their tactile senses, and to start thinking spatially. Different clay techniques will be demonstrated and practiced, and projects will be based on observation.
event.title: FKT16BWC Build it with Clay (Grade 1 – 3) with TBD

event.description: Sundays 2:00pm-4:00pm 10 weks/20hrs Many artists adopted collage to eliminate texture and accentuate colour and shape. Students will be exposed to collages of Pablo Picasso, Jean Arp, Kurt Schwitters and others while encouraged to create their own, original design. Photomontage is a relatively recent attempt to join several images into a new composite. Often that “composite” was photographed to return it into a novel, seamless image.
event.title: FKT16CPMM Collage, Photomontage and Mixed Media (all ages) with S.B. Z.

event.description: Wednesdays 4:00-6:00pm  10 weeks/20hrs Young students are taught the skills of drawing and painting through observation by taking in the world around them and exploring different subject matter ranging from still-life, landscapes, architecture and the human form. Various techniques with pencil, conte, charcoal, watercolour, pen and ink, paint and pastels will be introduced.  Students will move from classical to modern techniques such as impressionism and cubism, with special emphasis on use of complimentary colours to achieve contrast, form and depth.. Starting from short studies in drawing, students will learn how to use those studies to build a painting. Some 3D techniques  and projects will be introduced as well.
event.title: FPF16YS Youth Studio (Grades 6 – 8) with Shoora Majedian

event.description: Tuesdays, 10 weeks/20hrs Our Kids Program is designed to spark creativity, allow kids to express their own ideas and help develop their imagination through fun and engaging age-appropriate projects and exercises.  Courses that involve drawing, painting, colour and illustration will introduced specific fundamentals and techniques such as the use of line, tone, colour and texture in achieving a sense of shape, form, depth and movement. event.title: FKT16AC Art of Cartooning (Grades 4 – 6) with Mike Goodge

event.description: Monday to Friday 3:30-6:30pm for 11 weeks/33hrs $10 at the door  Students may use studio equipment such as tables, chairs and easels, but are responsible for own art materials.
event.title: FA16OS Open Studio drop in (still life, no instruction) $10 at the door

event.description: Fridays 4:00pm -5:30pm 10 weeks/15hrs This class is about working together on a project to create paper “banners” by utilizing negative/positive spaces of various shapes. Shapes are glued in succession and each is conditioned by its neighbour obliging students to consider what was done by the fellow artist and respond accordingly. Cut-outs of Matisse will be used as inspiration.
event.title: FKT16CO Cut outs (11 – 14) with Srebrenka Bogovic Zeskoski/M. B. Jandric

event.description: Wednesdays 2:30-4:30pm,   9 weeks/18hrs Pets are cherrished, taken care of, huged, kissed, enjoyed, photographed.  Bring in a favourite photo of your pet and learn how to paint your pet's portrait. You can choose to use oil, acrylic or watercolours. The instructor will guide you in a step by step, one to one approach, in the process from sketching to the final painting. This is a fun course full of love and positive energy. A perfect escape during the darker, shorter days of fall and winter.

event.description: Volunteer opportunity that runs EVERY WEDNESDAY evening - Go once, go when you are available, go every week - its up to you. What will you do: Organizers will send you the meeting place the day before you are to volunteer.  This changes each week based on the donations being picked up. You will attend a variety of locations in Ottawa picking up donated furniture. You will take these donations back to a storage unit in the east end. From there you will fill a truck with donated furniture and deliver it to the homes of families in need (specific locations to be determined on a weekly basis).  It is amazing!! You will need a car or  will need to attend with someone who has a car ( carpool and go as a group)   AND be sure to dress for the weather.  Note: end time depends on how many people volunteer and is just an estimation

event.description: Part Christmas Carol, part pantomime, a twist of 39 Steps and a whole lot of fun nonsense; this 2 Man show of A CHRISTMAS CAROL COMEDY will be a new telling even if you have seen the movies 50 times... To save his beloved holiday from the Puritans who sought to squash it, Charles Dickens wrote a silly Christmas ghost story to resurrect the Ghost of Christmases Past. Now, in an age when Christmas shopping begins in September and the season is more full of stress and spending than it is of glad tidings, A CHRISTMAS CAROL COMEDY is sure to resuscitate your good humour and goodwill to all men but especially towards the two actors on stage tackling all of Dickens beloved characters! Mixing shades of Monty Python with the Shades of Past, Present and Future, this comedy is just the ticket for anyone aged 5 to 95 looking for a bit of festive fun. December 14-18, 2016 Staircase Café Theatre (27 Dundurn St N, Hamilton) Tickets: $15-$20 online or at the door (cash only) **wheelchair accessible by appointment. Please email noporpoiseproductions@gmail.com Directed by renowned actress Lynne Griffin (Santa Baby 1 & 2 as Mrs. Claus; The Glass Menagerie, Island Productions BC; as director: Baby Redboots Revenge: North American/Central Europe Tour), performer Sean Sullivan (Best known for his multi-award winning solo play Baby Redboots Revenge, North American/Central Europe Tour; and as Phil in Waynes World) lead the laughs. Written by Katie Leamen (Treasure Island, Solar Stage Dora Award nomination for Outstanding Ensemble TYA; Alice in Wonderland: A Tale with No Porpoise, No Porpoise Productions). Set design by Jake Gow (Technical Director, Ballet Jorgen). Associate produced by Rose Hopkins (recipient of the 2016 City of Hamilton Arts Award for Emerging Theatre Artist).
event.title: A Christmas Carol Comedy

event.description: A great opportunity for high school students with a keen interest in art and art related careers. You could be part of an intensive 10-week program gaining behind-the-scenes gallery experience, exploring a variety of art disciplines such as sculpture, printmaking, drawing, painting and more. You will create your own unique masterpieces, curate and install an art exhibit using industry standards. This program can help you make informed decisions about your postsecondary education in the arts. All art instruction will be provided by local artists from the AGB. Program starts October 3, 2016 and ends December 19, 2016 (10 weeks), every Monday evening from 6:30 – 8:30 pm. This program is FREE, however space is limited to 24 participants and registration is mandatory. Good news! Registration deadline was extended to Wednesday September 28, 2016 For additional information please contact rburke@cdhalton.ca Download flyer
event.title: Student Art Curator Program

event.description: Thursdays 1:00-4:00pm 10weeks/30hrs Artmaking is a continuous process of growth and exploration. To create a unique work of art in addition to personal inventiveness and imagination, competence, and knowledge makes it possible to bring that work to another level. The course combines theory and practice and aims to expose participants to various art movements which students will “resolve” in their own distinctive creations. Together we will explore how the Old Masters manipulated light and dark, as well as colour and space (especially as practiced during the Baroque period) and compare it with the momentous and a far reaching changes introduced by the Impressionist. We will also explore how “space” was historically resolved on a flat surface and how the twentieth century contemporary artists were keen to negate this, imaginary volume and depth. This course will satisfy a traditionalist as well as a more informal artist keen to experiment. This course will motivate participants’ ability and talent while increasing their skill and knowledge. There will be plenty of time for discussions, class interactions, but also ample “hands on” painting periods. Theoretical portions will be illustrated by visual projections (Power Point presentations).This is an equal opportunity class opened to beginners and advance students; we will all learn from each other.
event.title: FA16MSOP Many Styles-One Painting with Srebrenka Bogovic Zeskoski

event.description: Wednesdays 6:30-9;30pm 11 weeks/33hrs This course focuses on a modern approach to painting a variety of traditional subject matter including still-life, portraiture and landscape. Students are encouraged to develop their own expressive style through the use of colour and paint application. Suitable for all levels. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16CPT Contemporary Painting Techniques (B/I/A) with Shoora Majedian

event.description: CLOSER TO FOUND + WHITE FOX SOCIETY + ALONGSIDE + SEVER THE VOICES + GREAT GARDENING
event.title: CLOSER TO FOUND

event.description: AUGURY + GHOULUNATICS + BORN BROKEN + THE GOATBOX REBELS
event.title: La Grande Guignolée Underground 9

event.description: Fridays 9:30am-12:30pm 6 weeks/18hrs This is a hands-on course for those who wish to strengthen and significantly develop their perception and observation skills. Locations such as Rosetta McLain Gardens will be explored and painted when ever possible. Good drawing skills are welcome but not required, as those will develop in the process. The objective is to finish at least two detailed observational watercolour studies of a single flower and/or plant, and at least one floral/botanical more complex composition. Colour mixing and painting techniques will be demonstrated. This course requires dedication and discipline, while original personal style and ideas are encouraged and nurtured. Important works by various artists will be shown and discussed. Plenty of personal attention and one-to-one feedback. It is recommended that you carry a small sketchbook and HB pencil at all times. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16FBS Floral and Botanical Studies (B/I/A) with Jane Mikas

event.description: Thursdays 6:30-9:30pm 10weeks/30hrs Students will learn How to start drawing and painting and how to build an artwork; Using various material: charcoal, pen, pencil, ink, oil  chalk pastel, acrylic paint, oil paint, watercolour, collage and mixed media. Students will learn to understand various medium through experimenting variety of technique and style, from traditional to modern art approach through various thematic/motive.
event.title: FA16DPVM Drawing and Painting of Various Motifs (B/I/A) Nada Sesar Raffay

event.description: Tuesdays 9:30am-12:30pm for 11 weeks /33hrs Traditional Watercolour requires utmost discipline and focus in order to succeed. It does not tolerate mistakes very well, and trying to recover from them is mostly useless. However, a fast evolving modern technology has also affected the paint industry, creating new materials and changing and altering the properties of existing ones. As a result the medium of watercolour has also changed, allowing it to be much more forgiving and versatile, opening up exciting new opportunities to play and experiment with it much more freely. This course is designed for those ready to “let watercolour loose”, painting outdoors in the Bluffs when weather allows and from own sketches and notes when in the studio. Learn hands-on how to turn “mistakes” into desirable effects, while taking the journey into the unknown watercolour territory. It is recommended that you carry and use a sketchbook and a HB pencil at all times. We will look at important watercolour work of traditional as well as work by some contemporary artists. Plenty of personal attention and one to one feedback available. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16WP Watercolour Painting (B/I/A) with Marija Barac Jandric

event.description: Wenesdays 9:30am-12:30pm for 10 weeks/27 hrs As you probably know from experience, it is not simple to paint from a photograph, as the result is often a disappointing flatness and dullness. This course teaches what it takes to translate a photo image into a painting composition. You will learn hands-on how to “read” the photo, and how to select and correctly interpret the visual information captured by the camera. You can work in a medium of your choosing, while it is strongly recommended to carry and use a sketchbook and a HB pencil at all times. Previous drawing and painting experience is a plus, but it’s not a requirement for this course. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16PPH Painting from Photographs (B/I) with Marija Barac Jandric

event.description: Wednesdays 9:30am-12:30pm 9 weeks/ 27hrs Hands-on studio-based course for beginners and those who feel that they need a refresher or improvement of their basic drawing skills. In structured step-by-step studio-based exercises designed to develop your technique as well as your perception and observational skills, you will practice using pencil, charcoal, conte, and graphite sticks on paper. Through guided practice you will learn how to achieve the illusion of depth and distance through line, scale, perspective, tonal value, positive and negative space, and proportion. Basic composition will be discussed. Personal attention and one-to-one feedback will be available.  Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16DB Drawing Basics (B/I) with Ashley Johnson

event.description: Thursdays 1:00-4:00PM for 10 weeks/30 hrs You will learn how to create portraits and self portraits using various materials and techniques, with live models and/or from photography.  Advanced students will experiment with styles from classic and modern portaiture.
event.title: FA16DPPS Drawing/Painting of People, Portraits and Selfies with Nada S. R.

event.description: Tuesdays 1:00-4:00pm for 10 weeks/30hrs Drawing is so fundamental to human experience that we don't even think about it much. Kids draw before they learn to speak, and drawing is the first form of creative expression for a child. As we grow up we often forget how much fun drawing can be. This course will shed light on some traditional approaches to formal drawing, but it will mainly show and inspire a more contemporary expression based on the use of line. We will discuss how some drawing materials evolved and changed, while other ones remain the same for centuries and even millenia. A topic of digital drawing will also be addressed in the context of contemporary drawing tools. Be prepared for exploration and discovery on this journey. A lots of personal attention, hands-on-demonstrations, and class critiquing are  essential parts of the course. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16DE Drawing Exploration (B/I/A) with Ashley Johnson

event.description: Wednesdays 1:00-4:00pm 10 weeks/30hrs, model fee included The focus of this course is on exploring ways to capture form, movement and expression working with a live model. We will study short gestures, as well as longer and sustained poses. The course will cover skeletal and musculature aspects of anatomy, as well as basic portraiture. This course is ideal for students wanting to strengthen observational skills, and pursue figurative painting, portraiture, fashion, illustration or animation. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16FPDL Figure and Portrait Drawing from Life (B/I/A) with Shoora Majedian

event.description: Tuesday 1:00-4:00pm 11weeks/33hrs Colour owes it’s existence, and it’s appearance to light. Impressionist technique has resulted from the approach of trying to capture the observed impressions of colour affected by light, rather than the “real colour”. Paintings produced this way are dynamic, full of movement, and exceptionally beautiful. In this course students will work mainly from their own photographs depicting a scene with a strong sense of light and shadow. Emphasis will be on achieving a convincing sense of form, volume and spatial depth using a “colour priority” method of impressionist painting. Students will be coached on colour mixing in order to gain better command of tertiary colours, trying to avoid flatness and pastiness in their work. The objective is to produce at least two paintings per term, in either acrylic or oil or both, depending on what a student will choose to work with. This course is best suited for students with some previous painting experience. Material list provided.
event.title: FA16IML Impressionist Landscape (B/I/A) with Olga Battaglia

event.description: Thursdays 6:30-9:30pm for 9 weeks/30hrs Many artists adopted collage to eliminate texture and accentuate colour and shape. Students will be exposed to collages of Pablo Picasso, Jean Arp, Kurt Schwitters and others while encouraged to create their own, original design. Photomontage is a relatively recent attempt to join several images into a new composite. Often that “composite” was photographed to return it into a novel, seamless image.
event.title: FA16CPH Collage and Photomontage (B/I/A) with Srebrenka Bogovic Zeskoski

event.description: Tuesday 1:00-4:00pm 9weeks /27hrs, model fee included This course provides an opportunity for a sustained study of a pose over a period of several weeks. You will be encouraged to develop a personal approach and style through an informed, guided, and structured process of painting based on observation and keen perception. It is recommended to use water based medium such as acrylic, due to it’s fast drying time and easy care and handling. We will look at and discuss various samples of contemporary figure/portrait art, as well as some examples from art history. The goal is to successfully achieve illusion of form, depth, volume, weight, and space, through scale, proportion, tonal value, perspective, and use of colour. Model fee applies and materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16LDPS Life Drawing and Painting Studio (B/I/A) with Marija Barac Jandric

event.description: Thursdays 1:00-4:00pm for 10weeks/30hrs In the Classical Drawing Techniques course students will learn how to use the lighting in the classical style, as the lighting is essential in the classical technique. In this course, students will identify how to cast lighting on the objects to create a tonality of classical atmosphere.
event.title: FA16CDT Classical Drawing Techniques (B/I/A) with Mahmoud Meraji

event.description: Mondays 1:00-4:00pm for 9 weeks /27hrs, model fee included Portraiture is one of the most important and essential skills of the western visual art history. In this course students will learn how to approach  portraiture using "wet-on-wet", or “alla prima” technique. Special focus will be on the use of large brushes which allow students to capture the expression of the model face. Materials list will be provided
event.title: FA16OMT Oil Media and Techniques (B/I/A) with Mahmoud Meraji

event.description: Mondays 9:30am-12:30pm for 6 weeks /18hrs This hands-on, studio-based, structured course is based in colour theory and the primary colour palette, and it teaches how to develop proficient and accurate colour mixing. The objective is to help students develop their ability to make intuitive choices regarding proper use and application of colour. You will get to know and be able to use with confidence the colour properties such as saturation, temperature, and value to create a sense of harmony in your work.
event.title: FA16CF Colour Fundamentals (B/I) with Jacqueline Schaller

event.description: Mondays 6:30-9:30pm foe 10 weeks /30hrs For total beginners as well as for those with some drawing and painting experience. This course is designed to introduce students to formal approaches to still life. Through structured exercises in observation/ perception of elements such as lite, dark, texture, shape, form and distance, students will go from simple to more complex compositions. Foreground, mid ground and background, artificial horizon and a point of view, will be addressed, and basic aesthetic and stylistic choices will be considered. Important works from various contemporary as well as traditional artists will be discussed. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16ODP Observational Drawing and Painting (B/I) with Dara Aram

event.description: Tuesdays 6:30-9:30pm for 11 weeks/ 33hrs This course will introduce the dynamic world of abstraction, also known as non-representational art. You’ll investigate and create works in different abstract genres, learning a wide variety of techniques, and using different approaches to achieve depth, mood, form, space and texture. Learn how to develop your own colour palette and subject matter through exercises in colour and composition. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16APS Abstract Painting Studio(B/I/A) with TBD
Swim Kids 2/3
event.venue_name: Bulkley Valley Regional Pool & Recreation Centre

event.description: Tuesday 9:30am-12:30pm for 10 weeks /30hrs You will be introduced to the process of painting using acrylic and acrylic gels and mediums. Acrylic is essentially plastic, and it is opaque by nature. In order to make it behave differently, and become glossy or transparent for example,  you need to use acrylic mediums. Acrylic is a water based paint,  easy to start using but it takes time to get to know it well and be able to manipulate it the way you want it. The course will teach some finer techniques and approaches to paiting with acrylic, and demonstrations will be given. Colour mixing will be explained and demonstrated, as well as different application techniques. Important work in acrylic will be shown and class critiquing conducted. Personal attention and feedback will be given. Materials list will be provided.
event.title: FA16APF Acrylic Painting Fundamentals (B/I) with Ashley Johnson

event.description: Thursdays 6:30-9:30pm for 10 weeks/30hrs, The students in this course will became familiar with the visual art  language including composition and colour theories, and they will also become more familiar with art history. Requirement for this course is basic to intermediate knowledge of drawing and painting studio techniques, so that a student can learn in this course how to find out their own artistic style.
event.title: FA16CRAS Classical Realism Advanced Studio (I/A) with Mahmoud Meraji

event.description: Wednesdays 9:30am-12:30pm for 9 weeks/27hrs Impressionist approach is a result of studying the effects of light on the appearance of colour. Paintings produced this way are dynamic, full of movement, and exceptionally beautiful. In this course students will work mainly from their own photographs depicting a scene with a strong sense of light and shadow. Emphasis will be on achieving a convincing sense of form, volume and spatial depth using a “colour priority” method of impressionist painting. Students will be coached on colour mixing in order to gain better command of tertiary colours, trying to avoid flatness and pastiness in their work. This course is best suited for students with some previous painting experience. You can work in either acrylic or oil. Material list provided.
event.title: FA16IP Impressionist Painting (B/I) with Jane Mikas

event.description:
For the first time ever, Canada will host the ISU World Junior Synchronized Skating Championships in 2017. The championships will take place from March 10-12, 2017 at the Hershey Centre in Mississauga, Ont. Twenty-five of the top junior synchronized skating teams from 20 countries will compete for the junior world title.

"It is always an honour to host international events and we are excited to be hosting the ISU World Junior Synchronized Skating Championships for the first time," said Dan Thompson, CEO, Skate Canada. "Canada has a fantastic track record of hosting synchronized skating events. Most recently we hosted the 2015 ISU World Synchronized Skating Championships which was an extremely exciting event with Canada winning gold on home soil. We look forward to hosting the world once again in 2017."

The ISU World Junior Synchronized Skating Championships was a biennial event but it was recently decided at the 2016 ISU Congress that the event will become annual beginning in 2017. The inaugural event was hosted in 2013 by Helsinki, Finland. In 2015, Team Canada (Les Suprêmes) won the nation’s first medal at the championships, a bronze.

Ticket prices and information will be available later this year. Please check skatecanada.ca for updates.
event.title: 2017 ISU World Junior Synchronized Skating Championships

event.description: Gary Martin - Chicago Blues Master known as "The Prince of Blues" by his peers. Martin a resident of both Chicago and Calgary is working on a CD as a tribute to his late uncle and mentor Hubert Sumlin, collaborating with some of Chicago's finest legendary blues masters. Martin performs throughout North American and has recently been asked by the President of Sierra Leone to perform at a series of concerts in Africa. He recently performed at a private function for the US Ambassador to Canada at the request of the US Consulate General. As an ethnomusicologist, Martin is often requested to lecture on the "History of the Blues" at universities and colleges.
event.title: Gary Martin and the Heavenly Blues

event.description: Between the Badlands of Alberta and the Rocky Mtns, Dice Deluxe formed a unique blend of swampy jump blues and hoodoo boogie! A 3piece band from Calgary, writing and performing original music about local places and icons, as well as putting their stamp on some great cover tunes. The band plays in and around the Southern Alberta area.

event.description: This 10-week peer support program is aimed to support individuals through a deeper exploration of their grief experience following the loss of a spouse. The program provides a safe and supportive space to be in grief, to share and to listen; where those who’ve experienced the loss of their spouse can connect with others who’ve experienced a similar loss. Peers help reduce the isolation that many people experience in grief and provide hope that healing is possible. This peer support group is facilitated by trained facilitators who’ve also experienced the loss of a spouse, received support and want to help others heal.The program is also supervised by a professional consultant and practioner. Attendance is limited to 12 participants who must meet eligibility criteria. (Please see registration form for more details.) The program will run every Tuesday, from 7:00 to 9:00 p.m., from October 6th to December 8th, 2016. Since Bereaved Families of Ottawa doesn't get any governmental funding and relies solely on donations to deliver its programs, the suggestion donation for this program is $250 (with income tax receipt). If you don't have the ability to make a donation or just can make a partial donation, please contact our offices at 613.567.4278 or office@bfo-ottawa.org.
event.title: LOSS OF SPOUSE (10-WEEK GRIEF SUPPORT PROGRAM)

event.description: The world premiere of The Man Who Married Himself, is a stunning, South Asian-inspired masque, created by composer Juliet Palmer & librettist Anna Chatterton. Based on a traditional Karnataka folk tale, this is a powerful & timely story about choosing to reject or embrace the different layers of oneself: the feminine & the masculine, the beautiful & the ugly. Captivatingly told through music, words & movement, the production will feature: Singers Scott Belluz, Subiksha Rangarajan and Alex Samaras Dancers from Torontos innovative dance company InDance, which blends South Asian & Western dance traditions An orchestra combining Baroque & traditional South Asian instruments Directed & choreographed by Hari Krishnan. SUBSCRIBE AND SAVE 20%! Call 416-410-4561 or visit torontomasquetheatre.com
